Requirements: To be considered for admission to the University of Findlay, you must submit the following: Completed online application (there is no application fee), Official high school transcript... The University of Findlay is test-optional, meaning we do not require the ACT or SAT for admission. If you would like to have your scores considered, please have them sent to Findlay... When reviewing your application for admission, we will consider the following: Cumulative high school grade point average, Strength of curriculum, Class rank, ACT/SAT scores (if submitted).

To receive an admission decision, applicants must complete the Application for Admission (either the University of Findlay's application or the Common Application) and send in official transcripts from their high school and/or all colleges attended. The University of Findlay is a test-optional institution. The submission of an ACT or SAT score is not required for admission or scholarship consideration.

To apply, you must submit your application using the University of Findlay's free online application or through the Common App. You will also need to have your official high school transcript or GED scores sent to the Office of Admissions. The University of Findlay has a test-optional admission policy for most majors, but you may choose to submit your ACT or SAT scores.

First-time freshmen can apply to the University of Findlay using our free online application or through the Common App. Applicants must send official high school transcripts. The University of Findlay has a test-optional admission policy for most of its direct-from-high-school applicants, so sending ACT or SAT test scores is optional.

To be considered for admission, you will need to complete an online application and submit your official high school transcripts. Official college transcripts are required if you have taken any college-level coursework.
To apply as a first-time freshman, please submit the following: Completed online application or Common Application. Official high school transcript. Official ACT and/or SAT scores (optional).

To apply for admission to the University of Findlay as a first-year student, you will need to: Complete the application for admission. You can apply using the University of Findlay's application or by using the Common Application. Submit your official high school transcript. The University of Findlay is test-optional for most majors, meaning we do not require an ACT or SAT score for admission.

To be considered for regular admission, applicants will need to submit a completed application for admission and official high school transcripts. The University of Findlay is test-optional for most undergraduate majors, including Adolescent/Young Adult Social Studies. ACT or SAT scores are not required for admission for this major.

To be considered for admission to the All Hazards Emergency Management program, students must meet the general requirements for admission to graduate study at the University of Findlay and have completed a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.

In order to be admitted to the Master of Science in All Hazards Emergency Management program, the following must be submitted:
1. Graduate application and fee.
2. Official transcript(s) from all institutions of higher education attended.
3. Two letters of recommendation.
4. Personal statement detailing professional goals and reasons for seeking admission to the Master of Science in All Hazards Emergency Management.
5. A cumulative undergraduate grade point average of 3.0 or higher is required. Students not meeting the 3.0 grade point average may be considered for conditional acceptance.
To be considered for admission, you will need: Completed online application or Common Application; Official high school transcript; Official ACT and/or SAT scores (optional).

Application for Admission (There is no application fee.)
Official high school transcript or GED

To be admitted into the degree completion program, you must meet the following criteria:
- Completed application
- Official transcripts from ALL previous institutions attended
- Minimum of 24 semester hours of transferable credit
- Minimum 2.0 cumulative GPA from all institutions attended
- Be at least two years out of high school

Admission to this program is open to students who have completed at least 60 transferable semester hours of college credit. Minimum cumulative grade point average of 2.0 on a 4.0 scale. Students must also meet the general admission requirements for the University of Findlay.

Requirements: To apply for admission, please submit the University of Findlay's FREE online application or apply through the Common App. You will also need to send an official high school transcript. The University of Findlay is a test-optional institution, so ACT and/or SAT scores are not required for admission.

Cumulative High School GPA of 3.5 or higher on a 4.0 scale; ACT composite of 24 or higher or SAT combined of 1160 or higher; High School level math through algebra 2 with a grade of C or better in all courses; High school level biology and chemistry with labs with a grade of B or better in all courses; Completion of the Sonography Direct Admission Application

1. A completed application.

Students applying for admission must submit: A completed application for admission and scholarships [and] an official high school transcript. The University of Findlay has a test-optional admission policy. Students with a cumulative high school GPA of 2.5 or higher (on a 4.0 scale) are not required to submit an ACT or SAT score for admission. Students with a cumulative high school GPA below a 2.5 (on a 4.0 scale) are required to submit an ACT or SAT score for admission consideration.

To be eligible for consideration to the Diagnostic Medical Sonography (DMS) program, the student must: Be accepted to the University of Findlay. Submit a completed DMS application via the online sonography application system (SICAS) by Jan. 15. Have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Must have a 'C' or better in all pre-requisite courses, including Anatomy & Physiology I & II with labs, Chemistry with lab, Medical Terminology, and Physics. Must complete a minimum of two job shadowing experiences for a total of 16 hours. Must submit two letters of recommendation. Must complete an interview. A written essay is part of the application and a written essay is also completed during the interview day.

To be considered for admission, first-year students must submit a completed online application and official high school transcripts. The University of Findlay is test-optional. While not required for admission, students are encouraged to submit their ACT or SAT scores to be considered for some scholarships. Letters of recommendation and essays are not required for admission but can be submitted as supplemental materials.

Required application materials: Completed undergraduate application (Findlay’s FREE online application or the Common Application); Official high school transcript(s) from all institutions attended; Official ACT or SAT scores (The University of Findlay is test-optional).

In addition to the online application and fee, applicants must submit:

Official transcripts of all previous college work. The UNH Graduate School requires a minimum GPA of 3.0.
Three letters of recommendation.
Statement of purpose (approximately 500 words), indicating your primary areas of interest and reasons for applying to our program.
Writing sample (10-20 pages of critical or analytical prose on a literary topic; do not submit creative writing).
Resume (optional).
GRE General Test is not required.

Have a recommended high school GPA of 3.0
Exhibit a commitment to developing ethical leadership qualities
Complete the application, including the essay portion
Submit one letter of recommendation

Admission to the University of Findlay is based primarily on your high school curriculum and cumulative grade point average (GPA). You will have the option to submit ACT/SAT scores with your application for admission and scholarship consideration.

To apply for undergraduate admission, students must submit a completed online application and an official high school transcript or GED. The University of Findlay is currently test-optional, so standardized test scores (ACT/SAT) are not required for admission.

Students meeting the following criteria will be considered for direct admission to the College of Education: Earned final high school cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher. Submitted ACT or SAT scores. ACT composite of 23 or higher and no section score lower than 20. SAT combined score of 1130 or higher in Evidence-Based Reading & Writing and Math sections, and no score lower than 520. Students must also show evidence of a background check completed by the Ohio Bureau of Criminal Investigation and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (BCI & FBI).
All we need to consider you for admission is a completed application and official high school transcripts.

High School Prerequisites: One year of biology, chemistry, and algebra with a grade of C or better in each course. A fourth year of math is recommended.

Admission Requirements for the Professional Level of the Program: At the completion of the first year of the program, a limited number of students will be accepted into the professional track. Admission into the professional track is competitive and will be based on:
- An overall GPA of 2.5 or higher at the end of the spring semester of the freshman year.
- A grade of C or better in all pre-professional courses.

Unconditional acceptance to the University of Findlay. There are two paths for admission into the nursing program: Direct Admission and Standard Admission.

Direct Admission:
- Unconditional acceptance to the University of Findlay
- Minimum composite ACT score of 23 OR minimum SAT score of 1130
- High school cumulative GPA of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale

Standard Admission:
- Unconditional acceptance to the University of Findlay
- High school cumulative GPA of 3.2-3.49 on a 4.0 scale
- Composite ACT score of 21-22 OR minimum SAT score of 1060-1120

All applicants to the Graduate School must have a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university with a cumulative grade-point average of at least 3.0 (on a 4.0 scale). Admission to the psychology graduate program is based on a number of factors, including previous academic work (especially in psychology), letters of recommendation, statement of purpose, curriculum vitae/résumé, and a writing sample. Applicants are strongly encouraged to have completed an undergraduate or master’s level course in statistics as well as a course in research methods or experimental psychology. Research experience is strongly recommended.

Admission to The University of Findlay is based upon a student’s high school academic record, college entrance examination scores (when submitted), recommendations, and the student’s record of activities and personal characteristics. The application procedure requires applicants to: 1. Complete and submit the Application for Undergraduate Admission and Scholarships. 2. Request that an official high school transcript be sent to the Office of Admissions. 3. Request that official score reports for the American College Test (ACT) or the Scholastic Assessment Test (SAT I) be sent directly to the Office of Admissions.

The University of Findlay is test-optional. No essays or letters of recommendation are required to complete your application.

Completed graduate student application
A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution
Official transcripts from all institutions previously attended
A cumulative GPA of at least 2.75 on a 4.0 scale or a GPA of at least 3.0 in the last 60 semester hours of undergraduate work.
Successful completion of OAE content area exam.
Students must meet with the program director for an initial advising session to review an official transcript and develop a curriculum plan of study for licensure.
Students may also need to complete a background check at the point of admission into the program.
Students must also demonstrate they have met writing and math competencies for admission into the College of Education. These competencies are typically met by having successfully completed a college-level writing and math course.

Admission to the College of Education is selective and requires a separate application. Students are formally admitted to the College of Education after meeting selective admission requirements. To be admitted, students must have:

A cumulative 3.0 GPA in all coursework
Passing scores on the reading, writing and mathematics sections of the ACT or SAT, or passing scores on the Praxis Core Academic Skills for Educators Tests.

To apply as a freshman, students must complete an application for admission and submit an official high school transcript. The submission of ACT or SAT scores, letters of recommendation, and an essay or personal statement are optional.

The University of Findlay has a rolling admissions policy for most majors. Our admissions team carefully reviews each student's application on an individual basis, looking at grade point average, strength of high school curriculum, and ACT/SAT scores. We will need the following information to make a decision: 1. Application for Admission. 2. Official high school transcript. 3. Official ACT or SAT scores. The University of Findlay is test-optional for the 2024-2025 academic year. An essay, personal statement and/or letters of recommendation may be required for certain direct-entry programs or for scholarship consideration.

To apply to the University of Findlay as a first-time freshman, please complete the following steps:
Step 1: Complete an Application for Admission
Step 2: Submit an Official High School Transcript
Step 3: Submit an official ACT or SAT score report (optional)

To apply for admission, please complete the online application, request your high school transcripts be sent to Findlay, and send your ACT or SAT scores to Findlay. The University of Findlay is test-optional for the majority of our programs.

To apply for admission to the University of Findlay, you'll need to: Complete the online application for admission. Request that your official high school transcripts be sent to the Office of Admissions. The University of Findlay is currently test-optional for incoming freshmen who have a 3.0 cumulative high school GPA or higher. If you do not meet this requirement or wish to submit your scores, have your official ACT or SAT scores sent directly from the testing agency.

The University of Findlay is test-optional for most programs. The application process is simple. Here is what you need to apply:

Completed application for admission
Official high school transcripts
ACT/SAT scores (optional for most programs)
College transcripts (if applicable)
First-year students are accepted based upon high school GPA, ACT/SAT scores (optional), grade trends, and curriculum.

To apply to Findlay, we require the following: Completed online application and official high school transcripts. The University of Findlay is test-optional for the majority of our programs. This means you have the choice of whether or not to submit your ACT/SAT scores with your application for admission.

To apply for admission to the University of Findlay as a freshman, you will need to: Complete the online application. Submit your official high school transcript. The University of Findlay is test-optional, meaning we do not require an ACT or SAT score for general admission.

To be considered for admission, you'll need: A completed application for admission (Findlay's application or the Common Application); Official high school transcripts; ACT or SAT scores. Findlay has adopted a test-optional admission policy for undergraduate students. Students may submit ACT or SAT test scores for admission consideration, but they are not required.

Your application is complete once we have received the following: Completed application for admission. Official high school transcripts. Official transcripts from any college/university you've attended.

To be considered for admission, the following items are required: Completed application for admission; Official high school transcripts; ACT and/or SAT scores. Findlay has temporarily adopted a test-optional policy.
Program name: Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL)

Requirements: A completed online application, including: Application fee, Unofficial transcripts (official transcripts will be required if you are accepted into the program), Three letters of recommendation, Statement of purpose (2-3 pages), Writing sample, Résumé. International applicants must also provide proof of English proficiency (TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo).

To apply as a first-year student, you will need to:

Complete the Application

Submit your high school transcripts or GED certificate

Submit your ACT or SAT scores. Findlay is a test-optional university.

To apply for admission, you will need to: Submit your FREE online application and send your official high school transcript. The University of Findlay is test-optional, which means we do not require you to submit an ACT or SAT score to be considered for admission to most majors.

To apply to Findlay, you will need to submit the following:

Application for admission: apply online for free!
Official high school transcripts sent directly from your high school.

The University of Findlay has a test-optional admission policy. This allows students to choose at the point of application whether to submit ACT or SAT scores.

If you choose to submit test scores: Official ACT or SAT scores sent directly from the testing agency.
